data: For years my sister Harriet and I confined our relationships with the neighbouring town of Hempfield to the Biblical “yea, yea” and “nay, nay,” not knowing how much we missed, and used its friendly people as one might use an inanimate plough or an insensate rolling-pin, as mere implements or adjuncts in the provision of food or clothing for our needs.
browsing: culture/civilization/society|browsing: literature|browsing: fiction|category: novels|category: american literature
